intro: Pedicularis scardica, commonly known as the scarlet monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Pedicularis scardica is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often at high altitudes.
